basics.name: Minsung Cho
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: Cognitive Scientist specialized in Deep Learning and NeuroAI

work.name: Hantman Lab, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
work.summary: Research on behavior decoding from neural spike trains, focusing on whether ANN models recover meaningful neural information versus performing only low-dimensional embeddings.

work.name: Daegu Gyeongbuk Institute of Science and Technology (DGIST)
work.summary: Develop OBU integrated driving environment awareness and real-time driving environment information management platform supporting the development of Level-4 autonomous driving mobility system

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.area: Department of Software and Computer Engineering

awards.title: AI/Robotics Collaborative Research Program
awards.summary: Full funding for 6 month visiting research at UNC

publications.name: RaCUN : Research for Activation Function Based on Random Sampling to Increase the Robustness of Neural Network
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the Korea Artificial Intelligence Conference

publications.name: Toward Structural Similarities between the Brain and Neural Networks
publications.publisher: Annual Conference on Cognitive Computational Neuroscience (CCN) 2025

publications.name: Decoding Movement from Neural Spike Trains : A Comparison of Linear and Nonelinear Models across Brain Regions and Temporal Delays
publications.publisher: Annual Conference on Cognitive Computational Neuroscience (CCN) 2025

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
